gw.api.web.accounting

Class RawWriteOffTransactionView

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.web.accounting.RawWriteOffTransactionView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractWriteOff, ActivityApprovable

    public class RawWriteOffTransactionView
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractWriteOff
    Class to help with showing write-off's (in this case a producer write-off transaction) in a uniform fashion in the UI.

      • initiateApprovalActivityIfUserLacksAuthority

        public ActivityCreatedByAppr initiateApprovalActivityIfUserLacksAuthority()
        Description copied from interface: ActivityApprovable
        Initiates an approval activity if the current user lacks authority to approve any excess limits. The approval status will be set to either unapproved or approved based on whether approval is required.
        Specified by:
        initiateApprovalActivityIfUserLacksAuthority in interface ActivityApprovable
        Returns:
        The approval activity, or null if no approval is required.

      • doWriteOffWithApproval

        Specified by:

        public java.util.Date getExecutionDate()

        Returns:

      • getDisplayAmount

        public MonetaryAmount getDisplayAmount()
        Description copied from interface: AbstractWriteOff
        CommissionWriteoffs, ProdNegativeWriteoffs and AcctNegativeWriteoffs have the opposite point of view of all the other write-offs: a positive amount on a write-off typically means the carrier is losing money, but for commission write-offs it means the carrier will be gaining money.

        This method is intended to help ameliorate this inconsistency, by providing a getAmount method which always operates from the same (typical) point of view. In an ideal world, all write-offs would share the same point of view.

        This fix is filed under jira CC-60020. Upon completion of that jira, this method will no longer be needed.

        Specified by:
        getDisplayAmount in interface AbstractWriteOff
        Returns:
        The amount of this write-off to be displayed to user, positive if the carrier will be losing money and negative if the carrier will be gaining money.

      • getWriteOffTarget

        public KeyableBean getWriteOffTarget()
        Specified by:
        getWriteOffTarget in interface AbstractWriteOff
        Returns:
        The "target" entity for this write-off. For instance, an ItemGrossWriteoff will return the invoice item this write-off is targeting, a ChargeCommissionWriteoff will return the ChargeCommission, a ProducerUnappliedWriteoff will return the Producer, etc.

      • getWriteOffType

      • isPendingReversal

        public boolean isPendingReversal()
        Specified by:
        isPendingReversal in interface AbstractWriteOff
        Returns:
        true if this write-off is pending reversal (the user who reversed the write-off did not have the needed authority, and there exists an open approval activity for the reversal of this write-off)

      • isPending

        public boolean isPending()
        Specified by:
        isPending in interface AbstractWriteOff
        Returns:
        true if this write-off is pending (the user who made the write-off did not have the needed authority, and there exists an open approval activity for the execution of this write-off)

      • isRejected

        public boolean isRejected()
        Specified by:
        isRejected in interface AbstractWriteOff
        Returns:
        true if this write-off was rejected from being approved, false if it either hasn't been rejected, or approval wasn't necessary.
